SellingThings.synopsis: Dialog with Figaro in order to access the cosmetic elements. Before and After Dolor try to kill him.
SellingThings.how_to_trigger: Click on Figaro at his house.larian://bookmark?mod=GustavDev&level=BGO_Main_A&camPos=-1926.083618;40.470215;643.567688&camTarget=-1925.654297;40.129543;642.731262Relevant flags in this page: https://larianstudios.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/GUS/pages/2624159852/Lower+City+Debug+Commands

SellingThings_5.speaker: Figaro 'Facemaker' Pennygood
SellingThings_5.text: I must say... I'm damned lucky you showed up when you did. Can you believe what that monster was doing?

SellingThings_52.speaker: Player
SellingThings_52.text: Easily. I was even like that, once.

SellingThings_16.speaker: Player
SellingThings_16.text: A depraved mind will resort to terrible things.

SellingThings_47.speaker: Player
SellingThings_47.text: Unfortunately yes. I've been hunting him for quite some time.

SellingThings_1.speaker: Figaro 'Facemaker' Pennygood
SellingThings_1.text: Truly? Then you're made of sterner stuff than I, friend.

SellingThings_20.speaker: Figaro 'Facemaker' Pennygood
SellingThings_20.text: I'll confess, it terrified me greatly... Can you imagine dressing entirely in red? Hah!

SellingThings_25.speaker: Figaro 'Facemaker' Pennygood
SellingThings_25.text: Jests aside - thank you. You forever have my humblest gratitude and a most generous discount on my wares.

SellingThings_59.speaker: Player
SellingThings_59.text: Glad to see you in good spirits, Figaro.

SellingThings_33.speaker: Figaro 'Facemaker' Pennygood
SellingThings_33.text: In the face of such horror, I don't see that I have much choice. Now, how may I help you today?

SellingThings_19.speaker: Player
SellingThings_19.text: I'm glad you feel lucky. Do you also feel a deserving discount coming on?

SellingThings_36.speaker: Figaro 'Facemaker' Pennygood
SellingThings_36.text: Well, I'm not sure... Discounts are reserved for only the most loyal customers...

SellingThings_64.speaker: Figaro 'Facemaker' Pennygood
SellingThings_64.text: HAH! The look on your face. You really thought me that tight-pocketed?

SellingThings_26.speaker: Figaro 'Facemaker' Pennygood
SellingThings_26.text: You appear to be lost, dear. I specialise in fashion, not potato sacks.
SellingThings_26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Figaro gives you a once over

SellingThings_21.speaker: Player
SellingThings_21.text: Don't be rude! I don't want to get blood on an expensive suit.

SellingThings_75.speaker: Player
SellingThings_75.text: Perhaps I should let my butler dress me...

SellingThings_67.speaker: Player
SellingThings_67.text: Please, I look amazing in anything.

SellingThings_31.speaker: Figaro 'Facemaker' Pennygood
SellingThings_31.text: What's rude, dear, is strolling into a place like this looking like that.

SellingThings_62.speaker: Figaro 'Facemaker' Pennygood
SellingThings_62.text: A certain level of class is expected by my clientele, so if you wish to stay I must insist you purchase some less depressing garments.

SellingThings_22.speaker: Player
SellingThings_22.text: You're in danger. A killer is after you.

SellingThings_11.speaker: Figaro 'Facemaker' Pennygood
SellingThings_11.text: Hah, if looks could kill, Lord Gortash would've already hanged me. I wouldn't worry too much, this is undoubtedly some rumour cooked up by my many rivals.

SellingThings_12.speaker: Player
SellingThings_12.text: It's not a rumour, you're literally named on a list of targets. Other people on it have already died.

SellingThings_18.speaker: Figaro 'Facemaker' Pennygood
SellingThings_18.text: Well, I suppose if it's that elaborate a prank it rules out my sister as the culprit.

SellingThings_78.speaker: Figaro 'Facemaker' Pennygood
SellingThings_78.text: Carmen can barely organise her own shop, never mind stage a murder mystery to meddle with me.  Very well - I'll take my precautions. Thank you.

SellingThings_17.speaker: Player
SellingThings_17.text: Who would spread such a horrible rumour about you?

SellingThings_39.speaker: Figaro 'Facemaker' Pennygood
SellingThings_39.text: Well, my sister, for one. She can be a real piece of work - no doubt jealous of my success. But it seems too elaborate for her, I must say...

SellingThings_30.speaker: Figaro 'Facemaker' Pennygood
SellingThings_30.text: Figaro Facemaker. Born Figaro Pennygood, but father thought it best to take on the business' name when in charge of it.

SellingThings_57.speaker: Player
SellingThings_57.text: Remind me again - what do you sell?

SellingThings_13.speaker: Figaro 'Facemaker' Pennygood
SellingThings_13.text: A certain... Ineffable quality - beauty. In its many forms.

SellingThings_42.speaker: Player
SellingThings_42.text: I met your sister. She didn't have a very high opinion of you.

SellingThings_29.speaker: Figaro 'Facemaker' Pennygood
SellingThings_29.text: Well, the feeling is decidedly mutual. Her wares are a poor imitation of the clothing I have on offer here.

SellingThings_37.speaker: Figaro 'Facemaker' Pennygood
SellingThings_37.text: If she would just accept my offer to work here, like father wanted, we could resolve all this bad blood. But no. Too proud.

SellingThings_8.speaker: Figaro 'Facemaker' Pennygood
SellingThings_8.text: I sell anything and everything needed to cultivate your countenance.

SellingThings_44.speaker: Figaro 'Facemaker' Pennygood
SellingThings_44.text: The best you'll find in Baldur's Gate. Certainly better than any dreck you'll pick up in Wyrm's Crossing.

SellingThings_71.speaker: Player
SellingThings_71.text: Let me see what you've got in stock.

SellingThings_43.speaker: Narrator
SellingThings_43.text: *News of your good deeds has travelled fast. The merchant is all too happy to extend a certain generosity towards you, where the price of goods is concerned.*

SellingThings_77.speaker: Figaro 'Facemaker' Pennygood
SellingThings_77.text: Now remember - fashion's a fickle mistress, so be sure to return.

SellingThings_76.speaker: Narrator
SellingThings_76.text: *Your notoriety precedes you. Prices have been moderated to reflect your less than welcome presence in the city.*

SellingThings_41.speaker: Player
SellingThings_41.text: Oi! What's wrong with street detritus?

SellingThings_32.speaker: Figaro 'Facemaker' Pennygood
SellingThings_32.text: Yes, how very rude of me... Wearing Carmen's tripe-garbs is much worse.

SellingThings_69.speaker: Player
SellingThings_69.text: I'm looking to improve my attire, actually.

SellingThings_54.speaker: Figaro 'Facemaker' Pennygood
SellingThings_54.text: Well, that shoudn't be particularly difficult.

SellingThings_50.speaker: Player
SellingThings_50.text: How rude. I choose to devote my time unravelling reality itself, not cloth.

SellingThings_46.speaker: Figaro 'Facemaker' Pennygood
SellingThings_46.text: Oh gods no. No no no. My friend, it is my turn to save you - from the disgusting tripe-garb my sister has adorned you with.

SellingThings_60.speaker: Player
SellingThings_60.text: I thought these clothes looked rather nice.

SellingThings_72.speaker: Figaro 'Facemaker' Pennygood
SellingThings_72.text: They squander your most beauteous potential, and I will not stand for it.

SellingThings_66.speaker: Player
SellingThings_66.text: Show me something better to wear then.

SellingThings_34.speaker: Player
SellingThings_34.text: I'm just here to alter my appearance.

SellingThings_4.speaker: Figaro 'Facemaker' Pennygood
SellingThings_4.text: While you're wearing that fiasco of an outfit there's only so much I can do, darling. But fine.

SellingThings_55.speaker: Figaro 'Facemaker' Pennygood
SellingThings_55.text: Excuse me, beggars and waifs are not - oh. I see. You're not street detritus, you've merely availed yourself of my dear sister's... 'finery'.

SellingThings_56.speaker: Figaro 'Facemaker' Pennygood
SellingThings_56.text: Welcome back, friend. The fine facilities of Figaro Facemaker are yours to peruse.

SellingThings_68.speaker: Figaro 'Facemaker' Pennygood
SellingThings_68.text: Make haste, I have a very busy day of very demanding clientele ahead. What do you require?
